text: [Music]
And let's make a distinction
between the physical
environment that you know the the
substance the chemical substance and
rock and ice as it's called uh on the
one side and the living environment
which is the biosphere the this very
thin layer of life that covers the
physical environment. Um let's make that
distinction and then I can answer the
question which is that the
key threat to the living environment is
habitat destruction. We are transforming
the
natural world in which most of the uh
species of organisms live and have lived
for millions of years into a productive
land strictly designed for our purposes
or wasteland. We just leave it after we
go over it and take out what's there
like temper. And uh that then is the
greatest cause of destruction of
biodiversity. Include in that climate
change because the great destructive
effect of climate change as far as
biodiversity is concerned
uh is the shift of the temperature and
humidity zones too fast for organisms to
follow. Even where there are natural
reserves in which they can continue to
live.
[Music]
